newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thailand sees slower economic growth for 1997.
newsitem.headline: Thailand sees slower economic growth for 1997.

text.p: Thai Commerce Minister Narongchai Akrasanee said on Thursday that Thailand's economy is expected to slow to between six and seven percent in 1997 depending on international market stability.
He said the economy could slow to six percent if global markets were unstable this year but could steady to seven percent if world markets were relatively stable.
The Bank of Thailand recently revised its projection of gross domestic product growth this year to 6.8 percent from an earlier target of 7.1 percent and against an actual 6.7 percent in 1996.
